intro: Rorippa dictyosperma, commonly known as water cabbage or narrowleaf watercress, is a species of flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is an aquatic or semi-aquatic plant that typically grows in shallow water, wetlands, and along the edges of ponds and streams. The plant has alternate, linear to lanceolate leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are short, cylindrical siliques that contain numerous tiny seeds. Rorippa dictyosperma is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-rich waters and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
